result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachery T. Johnston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachery T. Johnston is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachery T. Johnston was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: **CORRECTED 9/17/15 - Paid in full from bond posted.**
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes all probation and pays all fines/costs

Supervision fees
Attend school on all school days and attend all classes on time. If misses class must be pre-arranged with prior approval from school or based on medical excuse with written note from doctor that states sufficiently ill to not go to school
Work to the best of ability while at school
Continue attending school until High School diploma is obtained
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachery T. Johnston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 1:32 p.m. Defendant Zachery T. Johnston in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm313 and 15cm144. Court statement to probation's request for review of probation conditions to allow defendant to obtain HSED or GED and not attend school. Court modifies conditions of probation - no longer requirement to attend school; however, will add requirement to obtain HSED or GED. Adj. 1:40 p.m.

2:30 p.m. Defendant Zachery T. Johnston in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm313, 15cm144, 15tr1724, 15fo923, 15cm376, 15cm266, 15tr1725. Plea questionaire filed. State moves to dismiss but read in Case nos. 15cm376 and 15cm266 - Granted.  In 15fo923 and 151725 - State moves to dismiss - Granted. In 15CM313 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 3 -7 - Granted. In 15cm144, State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. Defendant pleads no contest.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence:
In 15tr1724
Fine - $762.00 -probation to collect as courtesy
Driver's License revoked - 6 months
AODA Assessment
Driver's safety plan

In 15cm313 and 15cm144
WHS/POP 2 years CC
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Attend school on all school days and attend all classes on time. If misses class must be pre-arranged with prior approval from school or based on medical excuse with written note from doctor that states sufficient ill to not go to school
Must comply with all school rules while at school
Work to best of ability in school
Continue school until obtain high school diploma
Community Service - 50 hrs
Apology letter to Jeremiah Snyder - victim in 15CM313
Jail credit - 5 days
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes all probation and pays all fines/costs
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adj. 2:57 p.m.

02:46 pm - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Clerk of Courts office received phone call from Oneida Dispatch indicating defendant has been arrested for OWI, is in custody and will not be able to attend pretrial conference set for 3:30 p.m. today.  Hogan requests adjournment.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Must attend school everyday, every class on time unless medically excused.

02:39 pm - Defendant Zachery T. Johnston in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Benar/Hogan to bond.  Court continues $350 cash bond posted.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
